DAY 001.title: 우리에겐 온라인주문이 있지 (가정)

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Can you stop by the supermarket?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Sure. What do you need?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: We need some water and paper towels.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: I'll just order them online.

patterns: I read it online. : 나 그거 온라인에서 읽었어.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Gosh, my head's so itchy.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Eww! When did you last wash your hair?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Two days ago. I'm trying to save water.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: It smells, man! How can you stand it?
dialogue.ko: 냄새나, 야! 넌 그걸 어떻게 견디니?

DAY 003.title: 계산중 빼먹은 물건

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: You didn't ring up this one.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Oh, I'm sorry. Was that yours?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Yeah, I think you forgot to ring it up.
dialogue.ko: 네, 계산하는 거 잊으신 거 같아요.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: I thought it was the next customer's item.

patterns: I thought ~. : 난 ~이라고 생각했어. / ~인 줄 알았어.
practice: 1. 이것도 계산에 넣어 주실 수 있나요?
4. 난 네가 거기에 있는 줄 알았어.

DAY 004.title: 중요한 고객의 생일
practice: 2. 너 연필이나 뭐 그런 거 있어?

DAY 005.title: 좌석 스크린 없이 비행할 순 없지

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: My screen is not turning on.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Could you press the reset button?
dialogue.ko: 리셋 버튼 눌러 주실 수 있을까요?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: I already tried. It didn't work.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: OK. Let me move you to another seat.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Mom, can I play a video game?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Did you finish your homework?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: I'm almost done with it.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: You can't play it until you're done.
dialogue.ko: 다 마칠 때까진 하면 안 돼.

DAY 007.title: 여름방학은 왜 이리 짧니

dialogue.speaker: AI
dialogue.en: can't believe the summer break is over.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Gosh, I'm so depressed now.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: So am I.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: I am happy.
dialogue.ko: / B: So am I. A: 난 행복해. / B: 나도 그래.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: I am sleepy.
dialogue.ko: / B: So am I. A: 난 졸려. / B: 나도 그래.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: I should go home and get ready for school.

patterns: I can't believe+ ~. ~이라니 믿을 수가 없네.
practice: 3. A: 난 슬퍼. / B: 나도 그래.

DAY 008.title: 열 살 정도면 이런 선물 괜찮지

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: I'm looking for a gift for my niece.
dialogue.ko: 여자 조카를 위한 선물을 찾고 있는데요.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: How old is she?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: She's

patterns: I don't like carrots though. : 그렇지만 난 당근은 안 좋아해.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Aren't you going home?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: I can't. I have to finish this report.
dialogue.ko: 못 가. 이 보고서 마쳐야 돼.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Isn't it your wife's birthday today?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: It is. She said it's okay.

DAY 010.title: 위급 상황에 도와준 경찰

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Can you please take us to the hospital?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: What's wrong, ma'am?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: My daughter has a high fever.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Get in! I'll take you there.

patterns: I have a fever. : 나 열이 있어.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Is everything okay? You look so down.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Mayu is going back to America.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Oh, no. You mean your best friend Mayu?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Yeah... His whole family is moving back.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Do you have a Korean name?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: My friends call me Bongpal.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: It's a good name, but it doesn't suit you.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Give me some recommendations, then.

DAY 013.title: 꼭 원하는 셔츠는 없더라 [직업]

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: I love this shirt! I'll take two.
dialogue.ko: 이 셔츠 엄청 마음에 드네요! 두 개 살게요.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: I'm sorry. That's the last one we have.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Do you have anything similar?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: We have shirts with a teddy bear print.

practice: 4. 저희는 싱글 사이즈 침대가 있는 방이 있어요. EBS

DAY 014.title: 절대 웃지 않는 그녀

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: I don't think Ashley likes me. Ashley
dialogue.ko: 가 날 좋아하는 게 아닌 것 같아.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Why do you say that?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: She never smiles when she's with me.
dialogue.ko: 나랑 있을 때 절대 웃질 않아.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Maybe she has personal problems.

patterns: I don't think + ~. : 난 ~이라고 생각하지 않아. / ~이 아닌 거 같아.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: You're at the wrong gate, sir.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Huh? Isn't this the gate for Mayu Air

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: You have to go to Gate

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Oh, I'd better hurry. Thanks!

DAY 016.title: 아기들이 울 땐 이유가 있다

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Honey, Mayu won't stop crying.
dialogue.ko: 여보, 마유가 우는 걸 멈출 생각을 안 해요.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Did you change his diaper?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: I did. I even fed him.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Let's check if he has a fever.

practice: 1. 그녀가 문을 열 생각을 안 해.
3. 난 심지어 그의 기저귀도 갈아 줬어.

DAY 017.title: 외국인 친구 이름 지어주기Ⅱ 일상

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: How about Hajoon? It's a good name.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Oh, I love it! It sounds so unique!
dialogue.ko: 오, 엄청 좋아! 아주 독특한 거 같아!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: You know what? I changed my mind.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: It's too late. From now on, call me Hajoon Bint.

patterns: change one's mind : 마음을 바꾸다 (마음이 바뀌다)
너무 늦었어. 이제부턴 날 하준 Bint라고 불러.

DAY 018.title: 선택적 남은 음식 포장

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: I'd like to take these to go.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: You can take the burger, but we don't have a container

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: That's fine. I just want the burger.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: I'll be back with a box, then.

patterns: for the soup. : 버거는 가져가셔도 되는데, 수프용 용기는 없어요.
I will be back soon. : 금방 돌아올게.

DAY 019.title: 오늘은 과장님 심기 건드리지 마

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: What's up with the boss?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: She's in a bad mood.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Is it because of us?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: No, it's because she didn't get a promotion.

patterns: What's up + with ~? ~는 왜 저러는 거야? / ~에게 무슨 문제가

DAY 020.title: 잠겨 있는 비행기 화장실

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Is someone using the toilet?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: I think so. It says 'occupied'.
dialogue.ko: 그런 거 같은데요. '사용 중'이라고 되어 있네요.

dialogue.en: Well, it's been like that for a while.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: All right. Let me check.

practice: 3. 저희는 그것 같지 않아요. (저희는 안 그래요.)

DAY 024.title: 나 기억력 좋거든?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: It's your turn to buy lunch today.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: But I paid last time...

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: I bought you lunch because it was your birthday. Remember?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Oh, yeah. That's true. My bad.

patterns: It's your turn + to ~. : 네가 ~할 차례야.
I picked up the bill last time. : 내가 지난번에 밥값을 냈어.

dialogue.en: Dolneed my passport to visit Mexico?

dialogue.speaker: BYes,

DAY 026.title: 군 복무 중인 아들아, 힘내!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: When did your son join the army?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: It's been

dialogue.en: Oh, I almost didn't see him.

dialogue.en: I know. I should slow down.

DAY 028.title: 이래봬도 모델입니다 직업

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Wow, you have a great sense of style!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: I get that a lot. I'm a fashion model.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Really? But you're not that tall.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Well, I'm a hand model.

DAY 029.title: 아기랑 놀아주기로 했잖아

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Aren't you going to play with Mayu?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: I can't. I have work to do.
dialogue.ko: 못 놀아 줘. 할 일이 있어.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: But you promised. He needs you.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Right. I'll just do work later.

patterns: Aren't you going to ~? : 너 ~ 안 할 거야?
have work to do : 할 일이 있다.
I will see you later. : 나중에 보자.

dialogue.en: You lied to Mom, and she found out.

dialogue.speaker: B

DAY 036.title: 엄마를 닮아 약간 다행이다

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.en: Wow, your son looks exactly like his mom.

dialogue.speaker: B

dialogue.en: Well, I can't deny that.

dialogue.en: Hiring a babysitter is expensive though.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: Yeah, but we'll have more income.

dialogue.speaker: A

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.en: I guess it's not an easy decision.

be supposed to ~ ~하기로 되어 있다/ ~해야 한다

DAY 114.title: Are you John's girlfriend? 네가 John의 여자 친구야?

DAY 130.title: 보
